data.title: North Park Theatre
data.text:
"Presents the best and worst of its subject." - Film Threat

Learn about the life and essence of a leader who never compromised when the survival of the Jewish people were at stake.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

Learn about the unlikely birth of an LGBT institution, and what we can do to save it.

With a lucky run at the track and chutzpah for days, Franco Stevens launched Curve, the best-selling lesbian magazine ever published.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"A tonic for listless times." - TIME

Simultaneously an ode and a lament, ABOUT ENDLESSNESS presents a kaleidoscope of all that is eternally human, an infinite story of the vulnerability of existence.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Traylor's pictures stamp themselves on your eye and mind." - The New Yorker

Explore the work of a unique American artist, a man who was born into slavery and became an art titan.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"You'll smile throughout." - EasyReaderNews.com

After receiving notification via group text that they are being laid off, a group of hardworking female employees use the factory’s equipment to produce their own line of lingerie.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"The perfect blend of comedy, gore, and mockery of the state of online journalism." - Daily Grindhouse

Two men search for Bigfoot in the backwoods of Georgia.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

One of the most esteemed African films ever to hit the film festival circuit!

An 80-year-old woman makes a stand against land developers in this visually striking, magical realist tale.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

A Vatican-sanctioned look at the Holy See's engagements around the world.

Pope Francis addresses issues related to climate change, the refugee crisis, peace and religious tolerance, economic equality, compassion and humanity.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

“A bit like a visit to the perfume department at Galeries Lafayette before a taxi ride on a rainy day in Paris.” - The Guardian

A temperamental perfume artist clashes with her new driver, the only person in her life who dare confront her.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

“This is an entrancing film, orphaned by an unspeakable longing for a place–a whole world–that will never return.” - The Film Stage

Between the oppression of the city and the distance of his native village in the Amazon, Justino can no longer endure an existence without place.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

Featuring filmmaker Q&As!

Get a taste of modern French cinema!

The North Park Theatre proudly partners with Film at Lincoln Center and UniFrance to bring you a selection of four films from this celebrated French film fest, now in its 26th year.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"The kind of doc that bestows upon you a new hero." - RogerEbert.Com

Decades after photographing NYC graphitti, Martha discovers her work has made her an icon of a global art movement!

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

Screening as part of A TASTE OF RENDEZ VOUS WITH FRENCH CINEMA!

Fueled by impulse, a primary schoolteacher follows her secret lover into the mountains on a Robert Louis Stevenson–inspired camping trip—with a cantankerous donkey in tow.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

Screening as part of A TASTE OF RENDEZ VOUS WITH FRENCH CINEMA!

Vicky Krieps (Phantom Thread) and Vincent Lacoste bring a firebrand vitality to this true story of romantic devotion and radical resistance during the war in Algiers.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

Screening as part of A TASTE OF RENDEZ VOUS WITH FRENCH CINEMA!

This sharp & timely Cannes selection follows an auditor sent to evaluate an inactive airport in the South Caucasus, which could inaugurate a brighter chapter for the war-torn region.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"You’ll learn something new about a time in American history that most people know very little." - Film Threat

Learn the story of the father of the American Arts and Crafts movement, Gustav Stickley.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

PLUS: Watch an exclusive filmmaker Q&A!

STRAY explores what it means to live as a being without status or security, following three strays - Zeytin, Nazar and Kartal - as they embark on inconspicuous journeys through Turkish society.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

Isolation is a killer!

Two years into the pandemic, a group of friends throw a wild online party. After taking ecstasy, things go terribly wrong and the safety of their homes becomes more terrifying than the raging chaos outside.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"An involving and surprising portrait of the Renaissance legend." - THR

Forced to lie to maintain favor with his rival patrons, Michelangelo is progressively tormented by suspicion and hallucinations, leading him to ruthlessly examine his own moral and artistic failings.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Illuminating & moving." CRITIC'S PICK - NY Times

With unfettered access to the Zappa family trust and all archival footage, ZAPPA explores the private life behind the mammoth musical career that never shied away from the political turbulence of its time.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

You can't go wrong with great food, great friends, red wine and big laughs in Puglia!

Three life long girlfriends travel to Italy together to attend a cooking course in Puglia, and here they each find the opportunity to redefine themselves.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

Janus Films presents Andrei Tarkovsky's 1974 masterwork, newly restored!

A senses-ravishing odyssey through the halls of time and memory, Tarkovsky’s sublime reflection on 20th century Russian history is a poem of images, as much a work of cinema as it is a hypnagogic hallucination.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

From the director of incredible THE SHINING doc ROOM 237!

If simulation theory is not science fiction but fact, and life is a video game being played by some unknowable entity, then who are we, really?

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

Featuring a taped Q&A with star Isabelle Huppert after the show!

The story of two discreet lovers is flipped upside down when one of their daughters learns the women's secret.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"I loved—LOVED—every second of it." - Ken Burns

The film follows this alternative, small school's humanistic, anti-establishment origins in the early 70s through its survival into the 90s, when sudden demand led to a phenomenon of lines, camping and lottery systems.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Tazzeka has a lot to say about the passion that fuels people, the way society treats immigrants, and how those two elements interrelate." ~ Film Threat

An immigrant chef struggles against all odds to find success in Paris.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"As the virus resurges across the world, 76 DAYS suggests a way to face the future, with tears but perhaps also hope." - NYT

Health care workers and patients combat the COVID-19 outbreak during the first initial lockdown in Wuhan, China.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

One dad. Four kids. Ten days of chaos.

Managing people is his thing, so when Antoine's overwhelmed wife suddenly decides to leave him with their four kids, he knows it will be a piece of cake. But he has drastically underestimated the mess that they can cause…

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"A thoughtful, deeply felt movie of great sweetness." - Guardian

Kit returns to Ho Chi Minh City for the first time since he was six years old when his family fled the country in the aftermath of the Vietnam-American war.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

LA WEEKLY Critic's Pick

Audrey Flack is a provocateur and a rebel, an example and an inspiration. Queen of Hearts is a moving portrait of an artist who is still testing, still experimenting, still searching.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"The craziest action film you never saw." - VideoTalk

Turns out a stuntman-turned-filmmaker unleashed the most explosive, bullet-riddled, anti-human megattack in indie film history — shot in Texas – back in 1989, and no one knew… UNTIL NOW.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"A profound cinematic question about the nature of the country's conflicted soul." - IndieWire

In a Brazil where the Evangelical church has been integrated into all aspects of daily life, a public official works to save struggling couples from divorce.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Devastating." - LA Times

Amador is a notorious Galician arsonist who has been accused of causing a new fire. Lois, a young firefighter, explores the depths of a forest on fire. Their destinies are linked by the power of a mysterious fire.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"A must-see for any fans of Tarantino or Coen Brothers movies." - Flickering Myth

Who will get the bag of money, and where did it come from? An artfully constructed black comedy/crime thriller.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Arteaga sits with many of the survivors telling one horror story after another in what could be best described as a modern-day Holocaust." - Film Threat

Lawyer Carlos Spector fights for asylum rights for Mexicans who try to immigrate to the United States to escape from cartel violence.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Buzzes with the long-term historical power of the occasion, and notes the divisions that the organizers struggled to overcome." - New Yorker

Leaders gather at the National Black Political Convention in Gary, Indiana in 1972.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"The true miracle of this film is how Marcello translates both London's scabrous tone and lush prose into pure cinema." - NYT

Based on the Jack London classic—after Martin Eden meets Elena, he tries to achieve a place among the literary elite through self-education.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Made in Vermont on a budget of pennies and a wealth of soon-to-be-discovered talent." - The Movie Cricket

A carpenter struggles to move beyond his troubled past when he returns to his hometown to mend relationships, eventually finding solace in building a log cabin by hand.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Finally, Freyne has given us a romantic comedy in which the gay best friends are the leads, and it's all the richer for it." - Variety

A closeted gay teen and his lesbian counterpart pretend to be a couple to avoid suspicion.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

Based on the best-selling novel by Bonnie Jo Campbell!

After enduring a series of traumas and tragedies, a Native American teen sets out on an odyssey on the Stark River in search of her estranged mother.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"The movie's touch is light and its spirit buoyant, but there is no mistaking its seriousness or its passion." - NYT

Without a definitive biography, the unique personal journey of this diminutive, quiet warrior's rise to the nation's highest court has been largely unknown–until now.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"More than a million people have been displaced in central China to meet the needs of the future; Jia's flowing river of a picture washes over a few of them as they adjust to life's currents." - EW

A miner and a nurse face life-changing choices when they return to their Chinese village.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

Presented uncut & fully restored by the Noir Foundation's Eddie Muller!

Based on one of the most controversial novels of its day, Native Son exposed the injustices of black urban life, witnessed through the eyes of Bigger Thomas, whose morality was shaped by a lifetime of deprivation.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"A vertiginous, head-slapping examination of the tangible, unpredictable consequences of making art." NYT

An animated frog becomes a symbol of hate in one of the most talked-about docs of the year.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"The only film I ever watched where the audience started clapping halfway through." HuffPo

We Are Many is the never-before-told story of the largest demonstration in human history, and how the movement created by a small band of activists changed the world.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"An exceedingly tender and intelligent film about the beauty and grace to be found in death." - Tribune News Service

Lily and Paul summon their loved ones to their beach house for one final gathering before Lily decides to end her long battle with ALS. Starring Susan Sarandon and Kate Winslet.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"A potent and poignant reminder of how some things used to be and may never be again." - NY Times

Part-rockumentary, part-presidential portrait, the film traces the significant role music has played in President Carter’s life and work.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

" Deadpan, surreal and pandemically prophetic." - Movie Nation

Set just prior to the start of the 21st century, this vaguely futuristic story follows two residents who refuse to leave their homes in spite of a virus that has forced the evacuation of the area.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Even if [Herzog] one day set out to make a self-portrait of his life and work, it is hard to believe that it could be as penetrating and insightful as this film." - RogerEbert.com

Werner Herzog turns the camera on himself & his decades-long friendship with late travel writer Bruce Chatwin.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Heartrending and nostalgiac."- Asian Movie Pulse

Middle-aged Shokoo finds out that ex-husband, Fereydoun, has been placed in a nursing home by their children, and decides to take him into her home.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"You emerge from "Desert One" knowing certain aspects of the Iran-hostage crisis better than you did before. That makes it a worthy film, and an absorbing one." - Variety

A revelatory look inside Jimmy Carter's failed mission to end the Iranian hostage crisis.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Shades of Éric Rohmer...graceful and urbane."- The New Yorker

Eva is about to turn 33 and her decision to stay in Madrid in August has become an act of faith—an intimate, mystical, and festive summer film.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Otherworldly...warm and soft."- THR

When Jane (Sally Hawkins) is dumped at the altar she has a breakdown and spirals into a chaotic world, where love (both real and imagined) and family relationships collide with both touching and humorous consequences.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Does a good job of showing the systemic issues that plague women in politics." - NYT

Equal parts personal and political, REPRESENT follows three women on both sides of the aisle who share the singular goal of improving their community through public service.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"What Mr. Moland is after, in tackling an "unfilmable" novel, is evidenced in the visual tone, emotional content and Mr. Skarsgård's mutely eloquent performance."- WSJ

Stellan Skarsgård stars in a film based on a novel by Norwegian author Per Petterson!

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"A beautifully made minor-key tone poem about love, loss and death."- THR

In the streets of Paris, Juste collects the last memory of people only him can see, before helping them into the afterlife.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Notes of grace lift the story from the page." - THR

When a naïve pre-med student gets her first job in a nursing home, an unexpected friendship with Luis, an elderly Cuban musician, reignites her love of music and changes her life forever.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"An engaging and surprisingly playful documentary about the man who was arguably the most transgressive photographer to emerge from the 1960s & '70s." - Variety

Grace Jones, Isabella Rossellini, and more paint a wildly entertaining portrait of a controversial genius.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

Based on the popular French superhero show, now in English!

SamSam seems like he has it all: great family, great friends, and even his own flying saucer. But he’s still trying to find one thing that will make his life even better - actual superpowers.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

“I watched the movie with awe . . ." - Boston Globe

Learn the incredible true story of radical underground radio station WBCN-FM, set against the dazzling and profound societal changes that took place in Boston during the late-1960s and early-70s.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"After a lifetime reporting on conflict, Fisk reflects on the capacity of humans to cause large-scale chaos." - Guardian

Follow award-winning journalist Robert Fisk into relentless action--feet on the ground, notebook in hand, as he travels into landscapes devastated by war.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"As Beijing chips away at Hong Kong's freedoms, the Cantopop singer has become its emblematic figure." - The New Yorker

Follow openly gay Hong Kong singer and human rights activist Denise Ho as she uses her platform to fight creeping Chinese oppression.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Terrific....a sensitive & lived-in coming-of-age story." - IndieWire

Positioned against the backdrop of a rapidly expanding Seoul in 1994, a lonely 14-year-old Eun-hee moves through life like a hummingbird searching for a taste of sweetness wherever she may find it.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

A Hitchcockian suspense thriller!

A locked-room mystery with a twist: A slickly successful businessman wakes up next to his dead lover and becomes the chief suspect. His defense lawyer’s never lost a case, but can even she help him?

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"This tender, detail-filled movie lives for the moment." - NYT

A universal story of friendship, rebellion, and the irresistible power of music set against the backdrop of the Criminal Justice and Public Order Act of 1994, which banned unlicensed raves across the UK.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"A treat that becomes a chilling enthrallment." - WSJ

Despite the opposition of all the other teachers, Anna drives through the admission of a boy in whom she detects a remarkable musical talent.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Disarming....a beautifully humanizes a rock-casualty story." - Rolling Stone

Shannon Hoon, lead singer of the rock band Blind Melon, filmed himself from 1990-95 with a Hi8 video camera, recording up until a few hours before his sudden death at the age of 28. This is that footage.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"What's fresh about it: its questioning of gender, its use of dance not as an entertaining interlude but as a primary mode of expression." - NYT

Get up and dance with this uniquely sexy Hollywood romance, set in a NY world of gender-fluid and frequently naked bodies.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"A fascinating portrait of a modern-day, benign Ahab." - THR

Fascinated by the most fearsome creatures on Earth, famous photographer Amos Nachoum has developed a unique approach, one that puts him face to face with his subjects, without any protection.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Amongst the more unusual love stories I've seen in some time."- Film Inquiry

Two lost souls are powerfully drawn to each other and embark on an inescapable, intense and sexually charged affair on the West Australian coast.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Cramed with sly humor."- VARIETY

Kindly schoolteacher Albert Topaze is less innocent than he first seems.

Long considered a “lost” classic, Peter Sellers's first and only directorial effort sees the British comedy legend at the peak of his powers.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Takes a basic mystery plot, like something out of a TV movie, & uses it to ponder how each one of us could react to a ghastly crime, & how we expect others to react in turn." - THR

16 y/o Lise is accused of murdering her best friend, but the truth is more complicated...

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Bill Nighy is at the top of his game."- Forbes

Alan has spent years searching for his son who stormed out over a game of Scrabble. With a body to identify and his family torn apart, Alan must solve the mystery of an online player who he thinks could be him.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"A great story of a life lived devoted to the arts."- Film Threat

What do Jessica Chastain, Viola Davis, Patti LuPone and Adam Driver have in common? They are but a few of the extraordinary actors who have studied under Juilliard's renowned Moni Yakim.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Crackles with ideas and empathy, as Ferrara's best work always does." - NYT

Playing opposite the director's own wife and daughter, Willem Dafoe is a Ferrara-like American artist living in Rome in this improvised drama of doubt and disconnection, shot in self-reflective documentary style.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Although the odds of implementing all these ideas might seem steep, "2040" is a rare climate documentary with an optimistic message." - NYT

Structured as a visual letter to his 4-year-old daughter, director Damon Gameau imagines a cleaner, greener future.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Its sensitivity to how something as seemingly ordinary as food can have an immense emotional impact is consistently and unobtrusively profound." - Slant Magazine

Dinner plans take on unexpected significance in this thought provoking new film.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"This 1993 pseudo-documentary is weightier than it appears, a symbolic autobiography rather than a literal one." - The Age

Writer/director/actor Nanni Moretti offers a 3-part film diary which takes a sharply satiric look at Italian life.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Kristin Scott Thomas and Sharon Horgan combine to make acting alchemy."- Peter Travers

Faced with their loved ones' deployment to Afghanastan, a diverse group of women come together to form the very first military wives choir.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"One of the best films of SXSW 2019."- Variety

After discovering that her husband's addiction to escorts has left their family penniless, Alice finds herself drawn into the world of high-end prostitution as a means of caring for herself and her child.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"The film surprises, with incredible force, in every one of its 75 minutes....CRITIC'S PICK!" - NYTimes

Fairy tale logic mixes with unsettling David Lynch-like visuals and a dash of Chilean history to create one of the best animated experiences of the year.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"A high priority for cinephiles." - The Village Voice

While falling in and out of consciousness, an injured man reflects on the recent events that have transpired between him, his estranged wife, and his young lover.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

“With every kiss on the neck or touch of the hand, the director inserts muted sensuality to his love story.” – The Wrap

Winner of multiple awards, José is a gripping, layered and beautifully honest story about one working-class young man’s struggle to find himself.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"A vibrant, enlightening and foot-stomping tribute to New Orleans jazz."- Newport This Week

Rhythm is everywhere in this definitive doc exploring the rich musical heritage of New Orleans.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

This showcase of some of the most exciting new cinematic voices from France runs the gamut from animation to romance to absurdist comedy!

Revel in these petite Gallic pleasures, including award winners from Cannes, Locarno, and Palm Springs ShortFest.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Highly watchable....when 'Star Trek' utopianism met the glare of the mainstream." - The Playlist

Eight people quarantined themselves for two years in a closed-system biosphere with plants, animals, an ocean and its own atmosphere. What could possibly go wrong?

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"The sex-misadventure comedy we've all been waiting for, this time (FINALLY!) made by young women and starring young women!" - Narrative Muse

Young filmmaker Emily Cohn visualizes social media in an exciting new way in this BOOKSMART-esque Zoomer sexcapade.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"An evocative psychosexual thriller."- Variety

Reeling from a breakup, anguished Karen flees LA for her ex’s idyllic lake house in the Pacific Northwest. There, she becomes entangled with a mysterious, alluring younger woman whom she cannot seem to resist.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Romy Schnieder....can make a half-shy smile into the suggestion of unimaginable carnal possibilities." - Roger Ebert

In this newly restored Claude Sautet classic, two men vie for Rosalie's affections with unexpected results.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"A tonally complex comedy-drama about spousal abuse, infant mortality and misogyny told with magic tricks, puppets and slapstick." - THR

Mia Wasikowska stars in a visceral & darkly funny reinterpretation of the famous 16th century puppet show.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Enchanting....this portrait of spousal strife gives the genre a shot in the arm." - Little White Lies

A 40-something woman dissatisfied with her marriage is visited by the ghosts of relationships past.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"A sleek tour of economic history over the last 400 years or so." - LA Times

Based on the bestseller, this engaging new doc travels through time to shed new light on today’s growing inequalities.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

"Wickedly funny...an immaculate, taut portrait of pathetic navel-gazing masculinity." - Little White Lies

In this black comedy of middle-aged masculinity gone awry, Oscar winner Jean Dujardin (The Artist) is a recent divorcee who becomes obsessed with a vintage fringed deerskin jacket.

SHOWTIMES&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbspWATCH TRAILER&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp&nbsp

Inspired by a real story!
